text: Title: All of Us Strangers (2023) - A Mysterious Encounter Leads to Unforeseen Consequences Director: Andrew Haigh Writers: Andrew Haigh (screenplay by), Shion Sono (based on the novel "The End of the Century" by) Stars: Andrew Scott, Paul Mescal, Emma Corrin, Catherine Walker, Monica Dolan, Jodhi May, Hayley Squires, and more. Genre: Drama, Thriller Runtime: 1 hour 45 minutes Release Date: August 31, 2023 (Toronto International Film Festival); December 22, 2023 (USA); January 26, 2024 (UK) IMDb Rating: 7.6/10 (from over 800,000 users) Website: Link to IMDb Synopsis: In London, a chance encounter between neighbors Adam (Andrew Scott) and Harry (Paul Mescal) leads to an intriguing revelation â€“ Adam discovers that his estranged father (Jamie Bell) and mother (Claire Foy) are still alive and living in their old family home. However, they appear not to have aged since he last saw them thirty years ago. Awards & Nominations: - Golden Globe Awards 2024: Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role (Andrew Scott) - British Academy Film Awards 2024: Outstanding British Film, Best Director, Best Male Lead, Best Female Supporting Role, Best Adapted Screenplay, and Outstanding Debut by a British Writer, Director or Producer - Critics' Choice Movie Awards 2024: Best Picture, Best Director, Best Actor in a Supporting Role (Andrew Scott), Best Actress in a Supporting Role (Emma Corrin), and Best Adapted Screenplay - Independent Spirit Awards 2023: Best Feature, Best Director, Best Male Lead (Paul Mescal), and Best Supporting Female (Monica Dolan) Production Team: Executive Producers: Graham Broadbent, Pete Czernin, Taichi Yamada, and Shion Sono Producers: Peter Carlton, Luc Roeg, and Andrew Haigh Music Composer: Emilie Leveinasse-Farrouch Director of Photography: Jamie Ramsay Art Director: Sarah Finlay Costume Designer: Caroline McCall Editor: Jonathan Albertson Sound Designer: Mark Taylor Visual Effects Supervisor: Chris Lawrence Casting Directors: Shaheen Baig, Sarah Crowe, and Nina Gold Plot Summary: Based on Shion Sono's acclaimed short story "The End of the Century," ALL OF US STRANGERS follows the life of Adam (Scott), a successful playwright who lives alone in London after his parents passed away decades ago. One day, while walking through the neighborhood, he encounters Harry (Mescal), his mysterious new neighbor. Their conversation takes an unexpected turn when Adam reveals that he believes his deceased parents are still alive. Intrigued, Harry suggests they visit the house where Adam grew up. To everyone's surprise, they find Adam's long-dead father (Bell) and mother (Foy) living there as if nothing had changed for three decades. As the days pass, Adam becomes increasingly obsessed with this strange situation, leading him down a dark path filled with secrets and lies. Trailer Link: Watch Trailer Here
